articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Kyiv and Washington on Thursday hailed a deal giving the United States preferential access to new Ukrainian minerals as a milestone which a top U.S. official said would allow President Donald Trump to negotiate with Russia on a stronger basis.
articles.title: US says minerals deal will strengthen Trump in talks with Russia

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Trump administration has approached China seeking talks on U.S. President Donald Trump's singling Beijing out for 145% tariffs, said Yuyuan Tantian, a social media account affiliated with Chinese state broadcaster CCTV said on Thursday.
articles.title: US has reached out to China to talk tariffs, state media says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korea's Supreme Court overturned on Thursday an earlier ruling that had cleared election frontrunner Lee Jae-myung of election law violation, throwing into doubt his eligibility to run for the presidency.
articles.title: South Korea top court overturns presidential frontrunner's criminal case

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian drones attacked Ukraine's Black Sea port city of Odesa early on Thursday, killing two people and injuring five more, in addition to sparking fires and damaging infrastructure, the regional governor said.
articles.title: Russian drone attack kills two, injures five in Ukraine's Odesa

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The U.S.-Ukraine minerals deal is a full economic partnership that will allow President Donald Trump to negotiate with Russia on a stronger basis, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said.
articles.title: US-Ukraine minerals deal is economic partnership, signal to Russia, Bessent says

articles.author: Joshua McElwee
articles.description: As Catholic cardinals meet to choose a new pope, they will face a big question: Is it time, after three consecutive non-Italian pontiffs, to give the papacy back to the nation that held it for most of the 2,000-year history of the Roman Catholic Church?
articles.title: Will Italy get the papacy back after half a century of foreigners?

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel said it carried out a strike in Syria against extremists who attacked members of the Druze community, following through on a promise to protect the minority group as sectarian violence spread near Damascus on Wednesday.
articles.title: Israel says it hit extremists in Syria to protect Druze
Artist behind Trump portrait gifted by Putin says he hopes it brings peace

articles.author: Luc Cohen
articles.description: Sean "Diddy" Combs is due in court on Thursday for a hearing over the jury selection process for his upcoming sex trafficking trial, where the hip-hop mogul is facing the prospect of life in prison if convicted on all counts.
articles.title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs due in court for hearing over jury in sex trafficking trial

articles.author: Alien Fernandez
articles.description: Hundreds of thousands of Cubans gathered in Havana's Revolution Square for the traditional May Day march on Thursday, amid a grueling economic crisis and as tensions ratchet up with U.S. President Donald Trump's administration.
articles.title: Cuba stages May Day rallies as tensions mount with US
